definitions: fixed share or portion allotted to person, group, or nation
required amount of production or sales that must be achieved
examples: Each salesperson must meet their monthly quota to earn bonuses
The country exceeded its oil export quota this quarter
The factory struggled to meet its production quota during the shortage
Management raised the sales quota by twenty percent this year

definitions: passage or expression borrowed from another source with attribution
formal statement of estimated cost for goods or services
examples: The essay began with a famous quotation from Shakespeare
She included several quotations to support her argument
The contractor provided a detailed quotation for the renovation
We received three quotations before choosing a supplier

definitions: words taken from another source and repeated verbatim
informal statement of price for goods or services
examples: His favorite quote comes from Martin Luther King Jr.
The journalist used several quotes from the interview
The mechanic gave me a quote for the repair work
Get multiple quotes before deciding on an insurance policy

definitions: number obtained by dividing one quantity by another quantity
degree or amount of specified quality possessed by someone or something
examples: The quotient of twenty divided by four equals five
Students learned to calculate quotients using long division
Her intelligence quotient measured well above average
The team's success quotient increased after hiring new talent

definitions: Jewish religious leader qualified to teach and interpret Jewish law
examples: The rabbi led the Sabbath service at the synagogue
She consulted the rabbi about the wedding ceremony
Our rabbi teaches Hebrew classes on Sunday mornings
The community respected the rabbi's wisdom and guidance

definitions: small furry animal with long ears and powerful hind legs
meat from this animal used as food
examples: Wild rabbits inhabited the meadow behind their house
The pet rabbit hopped around its outdoor enclosure
The restaurant served rabbit stew with root vegetables
She learned to cook rabbit from her grandmother's recipe

definitions: disorderly crowd of people often associated with lower social classes
examples: The speaker struggled to calm the angry rabble outside
Police dispersed the rabble that gathered in the square
The politician dismissed his critics as mere rabble
A rabble of protesters blocked the main entrance

definitions: fatal viral disease transmitted through animal bites affecting the nervous system
examples: The dog was quarantined after showing signs of rabies
Vaccination programs have greatly reduced rabies cases
A rabies shot is required after being bitten by wild animals
The veterinarian tested the raccoon for rabies

definitions: grayish-brown nocturnal mammal with distinctive black mask markings around eyes
examples: Raccoons raided the garbage cans every night
The raccoon washed its food in the stream
A family of raccoons lived in the attic
Wildlife control removed the raccoons from the property

definitions: competition of speed between individuals or teams
group of people sharing common ancestry and physical characteristics
act of moving or progressing swiftly
examples: She won the hundred-meter race at the track meet
The horse race attracted thousands of spectators
Discussions about race relations dominated the conference
The census form asked respondents to identify their race
They had to race against time to finish the project
My heart began to race when I heard the news

definitions: designated track or route for horse racing or other racing competitions
examples: The famous racecourse hosted the Kentucky Derby
Thousands gathered at the racecourse for opening day
The new racecourse featured state-of-the-art facilities
Rain turned the racecourse into a muddy track

definitions: horse bred and trained specifically for racing competitions
examples: The racehorse won three consecutive championships
Investors bought shares in the promising racehorse
Training a racehorse requires dedication and expertise
The injured racehorse was retired to stud

definitions: person who competes in racing competitions
vehicle designed specifically for racing
examples: The professional racer won her fifth championship
Young racers competed in the junior division
He restored a vintage racer from the 1960s
The sleek racer reached speeds over 200 mph

definitions: oval or circular course designed for automobile or horse racing
examples: The NASCAR racetrack drew huge crowds every weekend
They built a new racetrack outside the city
Drivers practiced on the racetrack before qualifying
The racetrack featured both dirt and paved surfaces

definitions: track or course designed for racing vehicles
artificial channel directing water flow for industrial purposes
examples: The motorcycle raceway hosted international competitions
Drivers tested their skills on the challenging raceway
The mill's raceway powered the water wheel
Engineers repaired the damaged raceway after flooding

definitions: sport or activity involving competitions of speed
examples: Horse racing remains popular at many venues worldwide
She developed a passion for motorcycle racing
Racing requires both skill and physical endurance
The racing season begins in early spring

definitions: discrimination or prejudice based on race or belief in racial superiority
examples: The organization works to combat systemic racism
Historical racism shaped many current social inequalities
She experienced racism throughout her academic career
The policy was criticized for perpetuating institutional racism

definitions: person who practices or believes in racism
something characterized by or showing racism
examples: The racist was banned from the establishment
She confronted the racist who made offensive comments
They protested against racist hiring practices
The racist policy was finally overturned

definitions: framework or stand for holding or storing items
historical instrument of torture that stretched victims
examples: She hung her coat on the rack by the door
The wine rack held twelve bottles
The museum displayed a medieval torture rack
Prisoners were threatened with the rack during interrogations

definitions: handled frame with strings used in tennis and similar sports
loud unpleasant noise or disturbance
dishonest scheme or illegal business operation
examples: She bought a new tennis racket for the tournament
The badminton racket broke during the match
The construction created a terrible racket all morning
Neighbors complained about the racket from the party
Police investigated the gambling racket for months
The protection racket extorted money from local businesses

definitions: person who operates illegal business or extortion schemes
examples: The racketeer controlled gambling operations across the city
Federal agents arrested the notorious racketeer
The racketeer threatened businesses that refused to pay
Former racketeers testified against their associates

definitions: operating illegal business enterprises often involving extortion or fraud
examples: He was convicted of racketeering and money laundering
The investigation uncovered widespread racketeering activities
Racketeering charges carry severe federal penalties
The law firm specialized in defending racketeering cases

definitions: alternative spelling of racket used in tennis and similar sports
examples: The squash racquet required restringing after heavy use
She selected a lightweight racquet for better control
Professional players often customize their racquets
The sports shop offered racquet repair services

definitions: sport played in enclosed court with rubber ball and short-handled racquet
examples: They played racquetball three times a week
The racquetball court was reserved for tournaments
Racquetball provides excellent cardiovascular exercise
She joined the racquetball league at her gym

definitions: electronic system using radio waves to detect and locate objects
examples: Air traffic control relied on radar to track planes
The ship's radar detected an approaching vessel
Weather radar showed storms moving toward the coast
Police used radar to catch speeding drivers

definitions: tire with cord plies arranged perpendicular to direction of travel
arranged like rays extending from a central point
examples: The car needed new radial tires for winter driving
Radial tires provide better fuel efficiency
The radial pattern of streets confused newcomers
Artists created a radial design for the plaza

definitions: quality of brightness or light emitted from something
warm attractive quality suggesting health, happiness, or love
examples: The radiance of the sunset filled the sky
Stars lost their radiance as dawn approached
Her face showed the radiance of new motherhood
The bride's radiance captivated all the guests

definitions: emission of energy as electromagnetic waves or moving subatomic particles
medical treatment using controlled doses of radiation
examples: Solar radiation provides heat and light to Earth
Scientists measured radiation levels near the reactor
She underwent radiation therapy for cancer treatment
The radiation sessions lasted six weeks

definitions: device that transfers heat to warm a room or space
device in vehicles that cools engine by heat dissipation
examples: The old radiator clanged when the heat turned on
She placed wet clothes on the radiator to dry
The car's radiator leaked coolant onto the driveway
Mechanics replaced the damaged radiator

definitions: person advocating thorough or complete political or social change
relating to or affecting fundamental nature of something
atom or group of atoms with unpaired electrons
examples: Political radicals demanded immediate government reform
The radical led protests against the establishment
The company underwent radical restructuring
Her radical approach challenged traditional methods
Free radicals can damage cells in the body
The chemical radical remained highly reactive

definitions: beliefs or actions supporting extreme political or social reform
examples: His radicalism alienated moderate supporters
The movement embraced radicalism to achieve rapid change
Student radicalism peaked during the protest era
Political radicalism shaped the country's history

definitions: system of broadcasting sound programs to the public
device for receiving or transmitting radio waves
examples: She listened to news on the radio every morning
The radio station played classic rock music
The pilot communicated through the plane's radio
Emergency crews used radios to coordinate rescue efforts

definitions: property of atomic nuclei spontaneously emitting particles or radiation
examples: Scientists detected high radioactivity near the uranium deposit
The radioactivity decreased over several half-lives
Geiger counters measure radioactivity levels
Natural radioactivity occurs in granite rocks

definitions: physician specializing in medical imaging and interpretation of radiological tests
examples: The radiologist examined the X-rays for abnormalities
She consulted with a radiologist about the MRI results
Radiologists use various imaging technologies for diagnosis
The hospital hired two new radiologists

definitions: branch of medicine using imaging technology for diagnosis and treatment
examples: She studied radiology at medical school
The radiology department purchased new scanning equipment
Advances in radiology improved cancer detection rates
Patients waited in the radiology waiting room

definitions: treatment of disease especially cancer using controlled doses of radiation
examples: The oncologist recommended radiotherapy after surgery
Modern radiotherapy techniques minimize damage to healthy tissue
She completed six weeks of radiotherapy
The radiotherapy center treated hundreds of patients annually

definitions: small edible root vegetable with pungent flavor and crisp texture
examples: She added sliced radishes to the salad
The garden produced both red and white radishes
Pickled radish accompanied the Korean barbecue
Fresh radishes provided a spicy crunch

definitions: highly radioactive metallic element used in cancer treatment and luminous paints
examples: Marie Curie discovered radium in 1898
Early watch dials used radium for luminescence
Radium therapy was an early cancer treatment
The radium contamination required extensive cleanup

definitions: colorless radioactive gas produced by radium decay posing health risks
examples: Homeowners tested basement air for radon levels
Radon exposure increases lung cancer risk
The radon mitigation system vented gas outside
Inspectors found dangerous radon concentrations

definitions: lottery with goods as prizes typically used for fundraising
examples: The school raffle raised money for new equipment
She won a vacation package in the charity raffle
They sold raffle tickets at the community fair
The raffle drawing takes place next Saturday

definitions: flat floating structure for transportation or recreation on water
large number or amount of something
examples: They built a raft from logs and rope
The inflatable raft carried six passengers
The committee faced a raft of complaints
She received a raft of job offers

definitions: sloping beam supporting a roof structure
person who travels by raft especially recreationally
examples: Exposed rafters gave the cabin a rustic appearance
The carpenter replaced the damaged rafters
Experienced rafters navigated the challenging rapids
The rafters camped along the riverbank

definitions: torn or worn piece of cloth used for cleaning
informal term for newspaper especially tabloid
examples: He wiped the spill with an old rag
The mechanic kept rags for cleaning tools
Don't believe everything you read in that rag
The local rag published sensational stories

definitions: violent uncontrollable anger or fury
widespread temporary enthusiasm or fashion
examples: His rage frightened everyone in the room
She struggled to control her rage at the injustice
Minimalist design became the rage last year
Video games were all the rage among teenagers

definitions: syncopated musical style popular in early twentieth century America
examples: Scott Joplin composed famous ragtime pieces
The pianist played ragtime at the jazz festival
Ragtime influenced the development of jazz music
The ragtime era lasted from 1895 to 1919

definitions: sudden attack on enemy or criminal location
surprise visit by police to arrest suspects or seize evidence
examples: Viking raids terrorized coastal settlements
The military planned a raid on enemy supplies
Police conducted raids on suspected drug houses
The FBI raid recovered stolen artwork

definitions: person who attacks suddenly to steal or destroy
person or company making hostile takeover attempts
examples: Raiders attacked the village at dawn
Ancient raiders plundered coastal towns
The corporate raider acquired several companies
Raiders targeted undervalued businesses

definitions: steel bar forming part of railroad track
horizontal bar used as guard or barrier
bitter complaint or criticism
examples: Workers replaced the damaged rail section
The train wheels rolled smoothly along the rails
She gripped the stair rail for support
The deck rail prevented falls
Critics continued to rail against the policy
He would rail about injustice for hours

definitions: wheeled vehicle designed for movement on railroad tracks
examples: The freight railcar carried grain to market
Vintage railcars were restored for tourist rides
Each railcar could hold forty passengers
Workers unloaded cargo from the railcars

definitions: fence or barrier made of rails to prevent falls
examples: Children held onto the railing while climbing stairs
The balcony railing met safety code requirements
Decorative iron railings surrounded the garden
She leaned against the railing to watch the sunset
